DataElement.preferredName: Excision Less Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Date Calculated Day Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval from the date of a person's surgical resection procedure to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins._The act of removing a part from the whole._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins._The act of removing a part from the whole._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
The act of removing a part from the whole.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 2023.7.19 Updated def for 'No Value Exists'. ak

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of Days from Date of Initial Pathologic Diagnosis to Date of Additional Surgery for New Tumor Event
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of Days from Date of Initial Pathologic Diagnosis to Date of Additional Surgery for New Tumor Event

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support TCGA project. 2/9/10 Added alternate question text per TCGA request. mc 2/29/12
